title: Egor Zaitsev
subtitle: Senior Software Engineer
description: Professional full stack engineer with 5+ years of experience in creating complex but user-friendly web applications for Profi.ru, OSOME & others.
print: This is a printed version of

events.name: Senior Software Engineer
events.text: - From the ground up built a community platform for over 15k fellows that allowed them to make the most of their experience at On Deck: reach out and connect to other fellows, watch sessions, RSVP to online and IRL events and many many more. - Crafted a beautiful and functional UI kit of 50+ accessible components that allowed all projects to have a consistent look and feel, while being extremely versatile and easy to use by developers. - Spearheaded the development of a React Native based mobile app that allowed fellows to reveive push notifications to timely react to other people's asks, intro requests and more. - Provided constant support and mentoring to junior engineers and interns to help hone their skills and boost their development.

events.name: Senior Fullstack Engineer
events.text: - Designed and created a serverless service for receiving files over email using `amazon ses`, which enabled clients to forward their bills and invoices to a special email address and they automatically would be uploaded to the application. When forwarded email does not have any attachments, a PDF version of its content is created using `puppeteer`. - One of the main developers on a project for creating a application-wide demo mode, which enabled clients to get acquainted with the application interface and functionality before actually paying for the subscription. - Initiated the change of code hosting from BitBucket to GitHub, which greatly improved developer experience and allowed us to *save ~$4000 per year* on CI. During the transition I set up CI/CD for 50+ company repositories and wrote several custom actions to support preexisting workflow scenarios. - Author and maintainer of several Slack bots that enabled developers to deploy applications without ever leaving Slack and to painlessly book and use shared infrastructure and resources. Built with <3 with `aws` and `serverless`.

events.name: Team Lead
events.text:
Singaporean fintech startup that provides incorporation and accounting services to SMEs around the world. *People manager for a distributed product team of 10 people.* My responsibilities included hiring employees, convening monthly 1-on-1 meetings and biquarterly performance reviews that resulted in formulating professional development plans for developers. As a technical lead I estimated projects and tracked their completion, decomposed product tasks during grooming sessions, performed code review and controlled the overall quality of delivered features. I also managed the technical debt and coordinated the communication with operations teams distributed over 4 countries — Singapore, Hong Kong, Malaysia and the UK.
- Identified bottlenecks in internal service desk processes and proposed a solution to incorporate support responsibilities into product teams, instead of assigning a single member of the team to service desk duty each sprint. Implementing the proposition resulted in *increased operational efficiency*. - My team and I designed and created a service for automated collection and processing of bank statements. Clients are reminded to upload the documents, which are then processed by an OCR service to extract relevant data which is in turn sent over to a `camunda` process engine, and operations teams are alerted in case anything goes awry.

events.name: Junior JavaScript Developer
events.text:
<div>
- Within a team of three I won the corporate hackathon with a project for a chatbot integrated with VK and Telegram. Its main purpose was to suggest tutors matching the specified criteria to its customers, push inactive customers into converting and upsell related tutoring services to them. This project received a commendation from the CEO and I was offered to form a small product team of my own to evolve this project further.
- Learned `react` the hard way: shortly after I joined the company my team was reassigned to another task and I was left behind to finish up the frontend for the customer account section of the website. That which does not kill us makes us stronger!</details>

events.name: Middle Fullstack Engineer
events.text:
As an individual contributor I led the effort to develop conversational interfaces and chatbots. Designed the architecture of the `node.js` service that allowed the company chatbot to seamlessly integrate with Facebook and VK. Discovered and implemented a way to *triple* the monthly amount of customers coming in from display ads in social media.
At the same time I was one of the core developers on the team that created and supported a platform for wizard-like customer interfaces. They were used throughout the main website and on a number of partner websites as a primary interface of placing orders with us by our customers, averaging *100k+ unique daily users*. We went through several major releases of the platform and gracefully shut down all outdated versions having migrated the platform customers.
<div>
- Trained a <abbr title='Machine Learning'>ML</abbr> model that showed 94% success rate in detecting intent of receiving tutoring services and classifying said services in user posts from social networks, scraped in real time.
- Implemented a version of `damerau-levenshtein` algorithm that allowed assigning arbitrary weights to different operations.
- Proudly designed and created an internal content management system that made use of business rules written in a custom <abbr title='domain-specific language'>DSL</abbr>. This introduced a shallower learning curve and helped cut personnel training time in half.
- My team and I received a CEO’s Choice Award after ranking 4th in a corporate hackathon with a project for seamlessly converting customers into service providers.</details>

events.name: Deputy Head of Analytics Department
events.text:
Achieved the position in two years. The main focus of my work was to manage product features for the [state property auctions website](https://torgi.mosreg.ru/) that was being developed by an external contractor. As a result of my work, the system was successfully certified and grew to have 10k+ unique daily users.
<div>
- Created a [company website](https://rctmo.ru/) in `PHP`, `CSS` and `JavaScript`.
- Developed <abbr title='Visual Studio Tools for Office'>VSTO</abbr> add-ins in `C#` and `Visual Basic` that calculated data and automatically compiled daily, weekly and quarterly reports.
- Introduced Microsoft Access into department workflow, which resulted in a significantly decreased error rate and a productivity boost after the transitional period.</details>

octokit.name: Octokit — official clients for the GitHub API

events.name: Community maintainer
events.text: Actively contributed to GitHub webhook events toolset for `Node.js` and its source for machine-readable, always up-to-date webhook events specifications. Large portion of my contributions were directed towards designing an autogenerated `JSON schema` that allowed easy validation of webhook events.

Author and maintainer of two `Python` network modules for managing configuration of MikroTik RouterOS devices:
- `routeros_facts` collects a base set of facts from a remote device.
- `routeros_command` sends arbitrary commands to a remote device and returns results read from it.

rosr.name: Federal Service for State Registration Cadastre and Cartography

events.text:
Two contracts for developing add-ins and utilities in `C#`, `Visual Basic` and `Powershell`.
<div>
- Developed a <abbr title='Visual Studio Tools for Office'>VSTO</abbr> add-in in `C#` and `Visual Basic` that enabled users to create Word and Excel documents using the data from Oracle and MSSQL databases. The resulting software was used by 50+ employees at the head office and helped reduce average document preparation time from 7 days to 1.5 days.
- Created a `PowerShell` command-line utility for batch processing XML documents that enabled users to quickly collect arbitrary information from a large set of data.</details>

events.name: Bachelor of Management Studies
events.text:
Majored in State and municipal management.
- GPA: **4.4**/5.0

events.name: Master of Engineering
events.text:
Majored in Technological machinery and equipment.
- Graduated with honours.
- GPA: **4.9**/5.0
